page.title: 13ECOLOGY OF EAST MONKLANDS 1
page.content: IN ITS 1981 LOCAL PLAN, MONKLANDS DISTRICT COUNCIL RECOGNISED THAT CONSIDERABLE RESERVES OF COAL, FIRECLAY, BLAS, WHINSTONE AND PEAT ARE STILL CONTAINED IN THE EAST MONKLANDS. IT WAS ALSO RECOGNISED THAT THE EXTRACTION OF THESE MATERIALS BY PRIVATE CONTRACTORS IN THE PAST HAS COMPLETELY DEVASTATED LARGE AREAS AND CAUSED {WIDESPREAD ENVIRONMENTAL {BLIGHT}WITHIN THIS RURAL AREA. IN VIEW OF THIS PAST DAMAGE, THE DISTRICT COUNCIL IS DETERMINED TO RIGIDLY ENFORCE POLICIES WHICH WILL ENSURE THAT SITES ARE PROPERLY RESTORED AND ENCOURAGES THE PLANTING OF TREES TO SCREEN VARIOUS WORKINGS. IN GRANTING PLANNING PERMISSION, THE APPLICANT OR THE OPERATOR OF THE WORKINGS HAS, BEFORE ANY WORK BEGINS ON SITE, TO LODGE A {RESTORATION BOND}WITH THE DISTRICT COUNCIL.
